Sentence.sentence: Even Africa and the Middle East, home to economies that are heavily dependent on fossil fuel exports, have enormous potential to develop renewables.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Very Serious People's attempt to cripple the economy.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: One recent study attempted to calculate the extent of this ecological overshoot of the human economy, and found that we are using 1.2 Earth's-worth of environmental goods and services—the implication being that at some point the debt will be called in, and all those services—the things which the planet does for us for free—will grind to a halt.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Medical spending, which typically rises faster than wages and the overall economy, is propelled by two things: the high prices charged for medical services in this country and the volume of unnecessary care delivered by doctors and hospitals, which often perform a lot more tests and treatments than a patient really needs.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It is also the reason why development agencies are not united in their view of environmental issues; while some, like the WRI, maintain that environmental progress needs to go hand-inhand with economic development, others argue that the priority is to build a thriving economy, and then use the wealth created to tackle environmental degradation.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: If our economies are to flourish, if global poverty is to be eliminated and if the well-being of the world's people enhanced—not just in this generation but in succeeding generations—we must make sure we take care of the natural environment and resources on which our economic activity depends.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But now, as then, powerful forces are ideologically opposed to the whole idea of government action on a sufficient scale to jump-start the economy.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And that, fundamentally, is why claims that we face huge structural problems have been multiplying: they offer a reason to do nothing about the mass unemployment that is crippling our economy and our society.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And on reflection, this is not surprising; the single word environment has so many dimensions, and there are so many other factors affecting wealth—such as the oil deposits—that teasing out a simple economy-environment relationship would be almost impossible.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A surprising thing for the man who runs one of the world's most powerful economies to say? Perhaps; though in the run-up to the five-year review of the Millennium ( ' ,  千年的) Goals, he is far from alone.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A few years later, a large defense buildup finally provided a fiscal stimulus adequate to the economy's needs—and suddenly industry was eager to employ those unadaptable and untrained workers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The U.S. is also the only advanced economy that does not guarantee workers paid vacation time, and it's  one of only two countries in the world that does not offer guaranteed paid maternity leave.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In emerging economies, rural communities are bypassing the wires and wooden  poles that spread power.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Add  a rapidly changing economy and an uncertain future to this 24/7 connectivity, and you've got a recipe for  overwork, according to Phyllis Moen.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Nor is the global economy forgiving of an American workforce with increasingly weak literacy, math and science abilities.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In particular, Arum and Roksa found, college students were not developing the critical thinking, analytic reasoning and other higher-level skills that are necessary to thrive in today's knowledge-based economy and to lead our nation in a time of complex challenges and dynamic change.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That’s bad for the economy, of course.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Add a rapidly changing economy and an uncertain future to this 24/7 connectivity, and you've got a recipe for overwork, according to Phyllis Moen.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Companies play a big role in creating a circular economy, in which value is generating less from extracting new resources and more from getting better use out of the resources we already have.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Companies play a big role in creating a circular economy, in which value is generating less from extracting new resources and more from getting better use out of the resources we already have—but they must also get customers engaged in the process.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Even in June of 2007, when the economy was still moving ahead, job growth was only 132,000, while turnover was 4.7 million!
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: If the economy starts to shrink again, Baily says, it would make a strong case for a second stimulus—something the Obama administration hopes will not be necessary.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: In many of these cities such as Denver, a diverse and vigorous economy attracted to the urban core has offered stable employment for residents.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: In particular, Arum and Roksa found, college students were not developing the critical thinking, analytic reasoning and other higher-level skills that are necessary to thrive in today's knowledge-based economy and to lead our nation in a time of complex c
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: In the past 12 months, Nigeria has suffered from a shrinking economy, a sliding currency, and a prolonged fuel shortage.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: It is also the reason why development agencies are not united in their view of environmental issues; while some, like the Wri, maintain that environmental progress needs to go hand-in-hand with economic development, others argue that the priority is to bu
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Medical spending, which typically rises faster than wages and the overall economy, is propelled by two things: the high prices charged for medical services in this country and the volume of unnecessary care delivered by doctors and hospitals, which often
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Now, Africa's largest economy is facing a food crisis as major tomato fields have been destroyed by an insect, leading to a nationwide shortage and escalating prices.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: One recent study attempted to calculate the extent of this "ecological overshoot of the human economy", and found that we are using 1.2 Earth's-worth of environmental goods and services—the implication being that at some point the debt will be called in,
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: simultaneously, technological advancement and global economy has reduced demand for well- paying blue collar jobs here in the United States.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: That's bad for the economy, of course.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The U.S. is also the only advanced economy that does not guarantee workers paid vacation time, and it's one of only two countries in the world that does not offer guaranteed paid maternity leave.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: with the benefit of hindsight, it looks like the Internet will transform the economy at something like the pace of other great inventions like electricity.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含有"经济的"之意。
means: economic ： 指与political"政治的"相对而言的"经济的"。
economical ： 指与"节约"同义的"经济"，含"节约，不浪费"之意。
financial ： 指"财务的，金钱的，财政的，财力的"。
economy ： 在名词前作形容词用，相当于economical，表"节约的"或"经济实惠的"。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 生态学的, 社会生态学的

stems_affixes.word_buile: economy[n.经济[学];节约]+ic……的→economic经济的,经济学的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 生态学, [社会]环境适应学, 均衡系统

stems_affixes.word_buile: eco环境,经济+nomy某一领域的学科等→经济[学],引申为节约

stems_affixes.type_exp: =a field of knowledge,表示"某一领域[的知识]"

stems_affixes.word_buile: anti反+nomy理论→相反理论→自相矛盾
auto自己+nomy统治,系统→自己统治→自治
eco经济+nomy某一领域[的知识]→经济[学],引申为节约

Sentence.sentence: A study found that a strong nifio in 1997-98 helped America's economy grow by 15 billion, partly because of better agricultural harvest, farmers in the midwest gained from extra rain.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Arts as an economic driver	our communities benefit from arts in terms of economy.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 填空题 原文

Sentence.sentence: As we move away from an industrial-based economy to a knowledge-based one, office designers have come up with alternatives to the traditional work environments of the past.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 选词填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Friedman points out that the green economy is a chance to keep American strength.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: How many cans will be used up in a cat's 15-year lifetime in a recycling economy?
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读C 题设

Sentence.sentence: In a recycling economy, we would make one set of 100 cans to start with, then replace them over and over again with recycled cans.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: In a throwaway economy, you would throw away 5, 475 cans over the car's 15-year lifetime.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Leaving aside the birth rate issue, India's economy may take off when the country achieves of educational opportunity.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 任务型阅读 题设

Sentence.sentence: More expressways will be built in sichuan soon to promote the local economy.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语四川卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Television gave another push to the local economy.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: The arts create jobs that help develop the economy.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 填空题 原文

Sentence.sentence: The change to a media economy started in 1920, when the nederlandse seintoestellen fabriek nsf established a radio factory in hiversum.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: There are solutions that could light a path toward a more sustainable and fair farm economy, but farmers can't clumsily put them together before us.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: This belief in "post-industrial society" has led those countries to neglect their manufacturing sector with negative consequences for their economies.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Ways of arts' promoting our economy	arts activity demands an joint/collective effort.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 填空题 原文

Sentence.sentence: As the economy picks up, opportunities will abound for aspiring leaders.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Yes , there has been a budding economic recovery since the 2008 global crash , but in key indicators in areas such as health and education , major economies have continued to decline.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That misses the way the surveillance economy works.
Sentence.come: 出自-2018年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Against a backdrop of drastic changes in economy and population structure, younger Americans are drawing a new 21st-century road map to success, a latest poll has found.
Sentence.come: 2016年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: But the headlong push into bachelor's degrees for all—and the subtle devaluing of anything less—misses an important point: That's not the only thing the American economy needs.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Despite graduating into the best economy in the past 50 years, Gen Zs know what an economic train wreck looks like.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Enhanced security measures since then, combined with a rise in airline travel due to the improving economy and low oil prices, have resulted in long waits at major airports such as Chicago's O'Hare International.
Sentence.come: 2017年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: For now it appears the economy is creating jobs at a decent pace.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: For one thing, it is very slow compared to the pace of change within the digital economy.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: In other words, they all share a view that the international tax system has failed to keep up with the current economy.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: In our rapidly changing economy, we more than ever need people in the workplace who can take  initiative and exercise their imagination "to respond to unexpected events".
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: In some ways the scientific publishing model resembles the economy of the social internet: labour is provided free in exchange for the hope of status, while huge profits are made by a few big firms who run the market places.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: since technology has such an insatiable appetite for eating up human jobs, this phenomenon will continue to restructure our economy in ways we can't immediately foresee.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The booming economy seems to have done little to assuage this underlying generational sense of anxious urgency, especially for those who have college debt.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The efforts of America's highest-earning 1% have been one of the more dynamic elements of the global economy.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The job security that the US economy once offered to high school graduates has largely evaporated.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The power and ambition of the giants of the digital economy is astonishing - Amazon has just announced the purchase of the upmarket grocery chain Whole Foods for $13.5 billion, but two years ago Facebook paid even more than that to acquire the WhatsApp me
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: They are energetic participants in a global economy driven by the flow of work, money and ideas.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: When the government talks about infrastructure contributing to the economy the focus is usually on roads, railways, broadband and energy.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Yet officials also hope for a much larger benefit: more long term decision-making not only by banks but also by all corporations, to build a stronger economy for future generations.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

jx.jx_en_mean: a proportionate saving in costs gained by an increased level of production
a proportionate saving gained by producing two or more distinct goods, when the cost of doing so is less than that of producing each separately
jx.jx_cn_mean: 范围经济，范畴经济，纵深经济

entry.def: An economy is the system according to which the money, industry, and trade of a country or region are organized.
entry.tran: （国家或地区的）经济，经济体制

example.ex: Zimbabwe boasts Africa's most industrialised economy.
example.tran: 津巴布韦是非洲工业化程度最高的经济体。

entry.def: A country's economy is the wealth that it gets from business and industry.

example.ex: The Japanese economy grew at an annual rate of more than 10 per cent.
example.tran: 日本经济以年增长率超过10%的速度增长。

entry.def: Economy is the use of the minimum amount of money, time, or other resources needed to achieve something, so that nothing is wasted.

example.ex: ...improvements in the fuel economy of cars...
There was mostly silence. I have never known such economy with words.
example.tran: 大部分时候都是沉默，我还从未见过如此惜字如金的情形。

entry.def: If you make economies, you try to save money by not spending money on unnecessary things.

example.ex: They will make economies by hiring fewer part-time workers.
example.tran: 他们将通过减少雇用兼职工人来节省开支。

entry.def: Economy services such as travel are cheap and have no luxuries or extras.
Economy is used to describe large packs of goods which are cheaper than normal sized packs.

example.tran: 内含150枚各种螺丝的经济装

entry.def: If you describe an attempt to save money as a false economy, you mean that you have not saved any money as you will have to spend a lot more later.
entry.tran: 假节约;看似省钱的做法

example.ex: A cheap bed can be a false economy...
example.tran: 便宜的床看似省钱，其实可能不然。

example.ex: It seems a false economy to me to cut down on libraries.
example.tran: 在我看来，减少图书馆的数量并不是真正的节约。

means.word_mean: 1. the system of production and distribution and consumption
3. frugality in the expenditure of money or resources;

sentences.sentence: "the Scots are famous for their economy"

means.word_mean: 4. an act of economizing; reduction in cost;

sentences.sentence: "it was a small economy to walk to work every day"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (in the sense 'management of material resources'): from French économie, or via Latin from Greek oikonomia 'household management', based on oikos 'house' + nemein 'manage'. Current senses date from the 17th cent

sentences.cn: 经济舱票价

sentences.cn: 我们需要厉行节约。
sentences.en: We need to make substantial economies.

sentences.cn: 买便宜衣服实际上划不来。
sentences.en: It's a false economy to buy cheap clothes (= it seems cheaper but it is not really since they do not last very long) .

sentences.cn: 她写作文字非常简练。
sentences.en: She writes with a great economy of words (= using only the necessary words) .

sentences.cn: 经济处于衰退之中。
sentences.en: The economy is in recession.

sentences.cn: 世界经济

sentences.cn: 在20世纪90年代爱尔兰是西欧经济发展最快的国家之一。
sentences.en: Ireland was one of the fastest-growing economies in Western Europe in the 1990s.

sentences.cn: 我们正在家里实行勤俭节约。
sentences.en: (British English)We're on an economy drive at home (= trying to avoid waste and spend as little money as possible) .

sentences.cn: 买这大包的实惠装吧！
sentences.en: Buy the large economy pack (= the one that gives you better value for money) !

sentences.en: to fly economy (class) (= by the cheapest class of air travel)

sentences.cn: 日本经济以年增长率超过10%的速度增长。
sentences.en: The Japanese economy grew at an annual rate of more than 10 per cent.

sentences.en: There was mostly silence. I have never known such economy with words.

sentences.cn: 他们将通过减少雇用兼职工人来节省开支。

sentences.cn: 内含150枚各种螺丝的经济装

sentences.en: A cheap bed can be a false economy...

sentences.cn: 在我看来，减少图书馆的数量并不是真正的节约。

sentences.cn: 这个收藏通过定期的书籍捐赠而得到扩充.
sentences.en: The collection was supplemented by regular donations of books.

sentences.cn: 他欣赏它的浓郁和可口的味道. 我则欣赏它的便宜.
sentences.en: He goes for its full, delicious flavors. I go for its economy.

sentences.cn: 蓬勃的经济为政府掩盖种种见不得人的东西.
sentences.en: A growing economy covers a multitude of sins for the government.

sentences.cn: 她倡导说节约是解决危机的最佳方法.
sentences.en: She preached economy as the best means of solving the crisis.

sentences.cn: 我们应当增加生产,厉行节约.
sentences.en: We should increase production and practise strict economy.

sentences.cn: 他们的国家经济停滞不前.
sentences.en: Their national economy is stagnant.

sentences.cn: 对经济的前景预测还不确定.
sentences.en: The prognosis for the economy is uncertain.

sentences.cn: 经济发展了, 人民的生活水平也随着提高了.
sentences.en: As the economy develops, the living conditions of the people have been improved accordingly.

sentences.cn: 我们需要厉行节约。
sentences.en: We need to make substantial economies.

sentences.cn: 我们正在家里实行勤俭节约。
sentences.en: (British English)We're on an economy drive at home (= trying to avoid waste and spend as little money as possible) .

sentences.en: It seems a false economy to me to cut down on libraries.

sentences.cn: 改变经济发展形式, 节约资源, 减少污染.
sentences.en: Change economy grows a form, resource conservation, reduce pollution.

sentences.cn: 另一方面, 要坚持增产与节约并举,把节约放在优先位置.
sentences.en: On the other hand, we must increase production and practice economy, with the emphasis on economizing.

sentences.cn: 反对大吃大喝,注意节约.
sentences.en: Oppose extravagant eating and drinking and pay attention to thrift and economy.

sentences.cn: 我们必须提倡节约,减少不必要的开支.
sentences.en: We must practice economy and reduce unnecessary expenditures.

sentences.cn: 节约本身就是最大的收入.
sentences.en: Economy is in itself a source of great revenue.

sentences.cn: 我们开展一次节约运动,以便储一些钱去度假.
sentences.en: We had an economy drive in order to save money for our holiday.

sentences.cn: 化工厂提出增产节约的倡仪,其他工厂随即响应.
sentences.en: The chemical plant proposed to increase production and practise economy and other factories presently responded.

sentences.cn: 咱们应当采取一项有效的节约措施.
sentences.en: We have adopt an effective economy meacertain.

sentences.cn: 在各方面都要厉行节约.

sentences.cn: 从那以后，安检措施有所加强，加上由于经济好转以及油价降低带来的航空旅行人数的增加，导致了人们在诸如芝加哥奥黑尔国际机场这样的主要机场长时间等待的状况。
sentences.en: Enhanced security measures since then, combined with a rise in airline travel due to the improving economy and low oil prices， have resulted in long waits at major airports such as Chicago's O'Hare International.

sentences.cn: 的确，2008年全球危机之后,经济复苏的萌芽就已显现，但是从健康、教育等领域的关键指标来看，主要经济体一直在持续下滑。
sentences.en: Yes, there has been a budding economic recovery since the 2008 global crash, but in key indicators in areas such as health and education, major economies have continued to decline.

sentences.cn: 这忽略了“经济”的运作方式。
sentences.en: That misses the way the surveillance economy works.

sentences.cn: 由于技术在吞噬人力工作方面非常贪得无厌，这一现象将会继续以我们无法即时预见的方式改变我们的经济结构。
sentences.en: Since technology has such an insatiable appetite for eating up human jobs, this phenomenon will continue to restructure our economy in ways we can't immediately foresee.

sentences.cn: 随着经济的快速发展，我们比以往任何时候都更加需要那些在工作中能够发挥主动性并运用想象力“去应对突发事件”的人才。
sentences.en: In our rapidly changing economy, we more than ever need people in the workplace who can take initiative and exercise their imagination “to respond to unexpected events”.

sentences.cn: 目前看来,经济似乎正在以良好的速度创造就业机会。

sentences.cn: 过去美国经济给高中毕业生提供的工作保障现在也已大幅缩减。
sentences.en: The job security that the US economy once offered to high school graduates has largely evaporated.

sentences.cn: 但慌不择路地将所有人推进学士学位——并微妙的贬抑其他较低的一切——忽略了重要的一点；那并非美国经济唯一所需
sentences.en: But the headlong push into bachelor's degrees for all—and the subtle devaluing of anything less—misses an important point: That's not the only thing the American economy needs.
